intro: Murbeckia haitiensis, commonly known as the Haitian murbeckia, is a flowering plant native to Haiti. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from yellow to orange. It typically grows in rocky or dry habitats, showcasing its adaptability to harsh environments. Murbeckia haitiensis is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and limited distribution.
